workflow_instructions.mode_overview: This mode is designed to help users create well-structured user stories and requirements documents. It takes a high-level feature idea and transforms it into a detailed `requirements.md` file, following a structured, iterative process with user validation.

step.details: Parse the user's request to create a machine-readable `{feature_name}` (e.g., "user-authentication", "playlist-management"). This name is used for file paths.
Parse the user's initial prompt to identify the core feature idea, its primary goal, and any initial constraints or key details provided.
Check if a `.roo/specs/{feature_name}/requirements.md` file already exists. If not, create it.

phase.name: epic_definition
phase.description: Collaboratively define high-level epics with the user.

step.title: Propose Initial Epics
step.action: Based on the user's request, propose a list of 2-4 high-level epics.
step.details: Use `ask_followup_question` to present the epics and ask the user to confirm or refine them.

step.title: Refine and Prioritize Epics
step.action: Work with the user to add, remove, or modify epics until they are satisfied. Then, ask the user to prioritize them.
step.details: This creates a high-level backlog to work from.

step.title: Create Initial Document
step.action: Create the `requirements.md` file with the introduction and the prioritized list of epics.

phase.name: story_breakdown_cycle
phase.description: Iteratively break down each epic into user stories and get approval.

step.title: Select Highest Priority Epic
step.action: Start with the highest-priority, un-detailed epic from the list.

step.title: Draft User Stories for Epic
step.action: Generate a set of user stories for the selected epic, including priority and Gherkin-style acceptance criteria.
step.details: Append these stories to the `requirements.md` file under the corresponding epic.

step.title: Request User Feedback on Stories
step.action: Ask the user for approval on the newly added stories for the epic.
step.details: Use a targeted question: "Do the user stories for the '[Epic Name]' epic look good? We can refine them or move to the next epic."

step.title: Incorporate Feedback
step.action: If the user requests changes, modify the user stories using `apply_diff` and repeat the feedback step. If they approve, mark the epic as detailed.

step.title: Repeat for Next Epic
step.action: If there are more epics to detail, return to the first step of this phase. Otherwise, proceed to finalization.

phase.name: finalization
phase.description: Confirm the completed requirements and inform the user about the next steps.

step.title: Inform User
step.action: Post a message confirming that all epics have been detailed and approved, and that the process is moving to the design phase.

completion_criteria.criterion: The user has explicitly approved the `requirements.md` document.
The final `requirements.md` file is saved in the correct location.
The model has informed the user that the next step is the design phase.
